alert.note: Alert for Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 3:24PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mason County through 415 PM CDT... At 323 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hilda, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hedwigs Hill, Loyal Valley, Hilda and Us-87 Near The Mason- Gillespie County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Texas.
